meanings.definition: To lie between layers of rock or sediment.
meanings.sent1: The small stream interbeds with the larger river.
meanings.sent2: The colorful rocks interbed beautifully with the dull ones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel interbeds with the birds, pretending to be one of them.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter interbeds with the sound of the falling rain, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread interbeds with the scent of blooming flowers, filling the room with a delightful fragrance.

meanings.definition: A layer of rock or sediment that lies between other layers.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found an interesting interbed while studying the rock formations.
meanings.sent2: The interbed of sandstone separates the two layers of shale.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel made its home in the cozy interbed between the rocks.
meanings.sent4: The interbed of clay acts as a barrier, preventing water from seeping through.
meanings.sent5: The fossil was discovered in the ancient interbed, revealing secrets of the past.
